item.title: Java Generics Type Parameter Bounds - CodeTab
item.description: Type Parameter Bound The List<E> can take any type as type argument. With Type Parameter Bound we can restrict accepted types. public class FoodList<T extends Food> { public void add(T element) { } public T get(int index) { // return element } } FoodList<Food> foods = new FoodList<>(); FoodList<Cookie> cookies = new FoodList<>(); FoodList<Apple> apples = new FoodList<>(); FoodList<String> apples = new FoodList<>(); // error The FoodList accepts Food or any of its subtype as T extends Food, but any other type is not accepted.
